key_points: Madame Tussauds moved Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's waxwork models from the royal section to the Hollywood zone in its London attraction.
The move reflects Prince Harry and Meghan's physical move from Frogmore Cottage in the UK to Los Angeles, USA.
Madame Tussauds London stated the relocation to the Awards Party zone was to mirror their transition from royal duties to a more celebrity lifestyle.
This change occurs a year after Prince Harry and Meghan stepped back from their roles as senior members of the British royal family.
A television documentary series on mental health, co-created by Prince Harry and Oprah Winfrey, is set to premiere on Apple TV+.
Ahead of the documentary's premiere, Prince Harry compared his royal life to the 'Truman Show' during an appearance on the 'Armchair Expert' podcast.
He also shared details about his and Meghan's attempts to evade paparazzi by meeting in a supermarket when they first started dating.
Prince Harry highlighted the sense of freedom and relief they have experienced since moving to California.
Their move to the USA allows Prince Harry to enjoy simple pleasures, such as taking their son Archie on bike rides, which he felt was not possible before.
The relocation of their wax figures symbolizes a significant shift in how they are perceived, from royal figures to global celebrities.
